messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Chianca column on unschooling (xpost from AU)
messages.msgSnippet: ... It didn t cost us anything. He s not trying to be funny, he s professionally paid to be funny, it seems. -=-my problem with his response is that it is an
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 23, 2006, at 11:50 AM, Daniel MacIntyre wrote:

> Of course, he's trying to be funny AT THE
> EXPENSE of unschooling.


It didn't cost us anything.

He's not "trying to be funny," he's professionally paid to be funny,
it seems.

-=-my problem with his response is that it is an attempt to throw off
responsibility for his words by saying "even though thousands of
people read
it and I never disavowed the opinions expressed therein, I'm trying
to be
funny, so you can't be offended".-=-

Freedom of the press.
Making a big deal out of it lacks realism and graciousness.

What we do *IS* funny, compared to school.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Chianca column on unschooling (xpost from AU)
messages.msgSnippet: my problem with his response is that it is an attempt to throw off responsibility for his words by saying even though thousands of people read it and I never
messages.messageBody:
my problem with his response is that it is an attempt to throw off
responsibility for his words by saying "even though thousands of people read
it and I never disavowed the opinions expressed therein, I'm trying to be
funny, so you can't be offended". Of course, he's trying to be funny AT THE
EXPENSE of unschooling. This is no more an excuse than it would be if he
were making fun of a racial group or a religion.

On 2/23/06, Liz in AZ <eerrhhaz@...> wrote:
>
> FYI, this is also being discussed on AlwaysUnschooled, where someone
> posted:
>
> --- In AlwaysUnschooled@yahoogroups.com, someone wrote:
>
> I saw that article last week and a friend wrote him an email. He
> did reply.
> This is what he said:
>
> >>>>Hi. I suspect you found my column on the Web, where it might
> have been taken a little bit out of context -- it's not an op-ed but
> rather a humor column, and my regular readers know that my
> simplistic take on topics is part of the joke. (The theme is sort
> of, "The world from the perspective of a goofball.") What you're
> doing sounds really interesting and I look forward to examining it
> further.
> PETE<<<<
>
> --- End forwarded message ---
>
> Liz
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>
>
>


--
Daniel
( Blogging at http://key-words.blogspot.com/ )

"When the solution is simple, God is answering."
Albert Einstein

messages.subject: Chianca column on unschooling (xpost from AU)
messages.msgSnippet: FYI, this is also being discussed on AlwaysUnschooled, where someone ... I saw that article last week and a friend wrote him an email.  He did reply. ... have
messages.messageBody:
FYI, this is also being discussed on AlwaysUnschooled, where someone
posted:

--- In AlwaysUnschooled@yahoogroups.com, someone wrote:

I saw that article last week and a friend wrote him an email. He
did reply.
This is what he said:

>>>>Hi. I suspect you found my column on the Web, where it might
have been taken a little bit out of context -- it's not an op-ed but
rather a humor column, and my regular readers know that my
simplistic take on topics is part of the joke. (The theme is sort
of, "The world from the perspective of a goofball.") What you're
doing sounds really interesting and I look forward to examining it
further.
PETE<<<<

--- End forwarded message ---

Liz
